strings: <se_low>Yangus: Er...guv. I 'ope ya won't think I'm speakin' outta turn, but...I think we should leave.
<se_low>Yangus: I just<endash> I can't relax 'round these parts.

<se_high>Jessica: Are you all right, Yangus?
Your face looks even more...I mean...it looks less...well...well than usual.

<se_def>Angelo: I agree that Yangus is looking a little off colour, but his instincts are spot on.
We don't need to be here.

<se_low>Yangus: So! Here we are, eh!? I've tried to prepare meself for this, but now that I'm 'ere...
Crikey, I'm nervous!

<se_low>Yangus: The Venus' tear...
Surely she can't still...
<se_low>Yangus: Nah, not after all this time!

<se_low>Yangus: She's wanted that gem for bloomin' ages now.
An' she never gives up on nuffin'. She's right dodgy<endash> I mean, dog-eared<endash> Nah! I mean, dogged!

<se_low>Yangus: I know we've already got the Venus' tear.
But if we go an' 'and it over just like that, she won't 'ave no gratistude.<page>Yangus: We gotta play the game a bit, see!
<se_low>Yangus: We gotta PRETEND we're goin' to the cave like wot she wants.

<se_high>Jessica: So this is where Red lives?
Nice location.
She seems to be doing pretty well for herself.
<se_high>Jessica: I expected a professional thief to live somewhere more, I don't know, dodgy. But even I wouldn't mind living in a place like this!

<se_high>Jessica: Red's pretty intense.
Talk about making us an offer we can't refuse.

<se_high>Jessica: Well, our hands are pretty much tied.
We'd better bring her that Venus' tear.<page>Jessica: But I have to say that this whole thing doesn't sit quite right with me.

<se_def>Angelo: Mitts was nothing more than a common criminal.
But Red... No, there's nothing common about Red. She's in a different league to that moron.
<se_def>Angelo: She's certainly an intriguing lady, living out here on her own with no one but herself to answer to.
<se_def>Angelo: Red's a very beautiful woman, but she's a touch too prickly for my liking.

<se_def>Angelo: I enjoy a conquest as much as the next man, but breaking down the doors of that particular citadel would require more than an attractive horse!<page>Angelo: I'll let another crusader lay siege to her.
<se_low>Yangus: Right then. At last we can give Red the Venus' tear an' get the 'orse-princess back.

<se_low>Yangus: This is just my kinda game.
The rest o' ya, watch an' learn!
See 'ow an old pro does business!
<se_high>Jessica: It's going to hurt, handing over something as beautiful as the Venus' tear, but who can put a price on the life of the Princess?
<se_high>Jessica: Let's just make the trade and get it over with!
<se_def>Angelo: Do you really think a shrewd outlaw like Red will go through with the exchange and hand over the Princess and the wagon for that jewel?

<se_def>Angelo: I just hope she keeps her end of the bargain.
She could steal the Venus' tear from us and refuse to give up the Princess as well.

<se_low>Yangus: Red ain't that kind o' girl!
If she says she'll do somefin', she'll do it, awright! I'll testify to that!

<se_def>Angelo: Yangus's testimony!?
And which court of law does THAT stand up in?

<se_low>Yangus: It ain't as 'ard comin' 'ere as it was before.
I mean, I ain't as nervous as I was.
<se_low>Yangus: But I'm gettin' pretty tired of 'er layin' into me the 'ole time!
<se_high>Jessica: I envy the freedom of Red's lifestyle.
<se_high>Jessica: Maybe once all of this is said and done, I should try striking out on my own.
<se_high>Jessica: My mother would never let me hear the end of it, though. She's stubborn like that.
<se_def>Angelo: I'd say there's a reason for Red's volatile temper whenever Yangus is around. In my ‘professional’ opinion, there's some chemistry there.

<se_def>Angelo: But don't ask me for advice.
I'm no love doctor.
I'm a practitioner, not a consultant!
<se_def>Angelo: They should be able to figure it out for themselves at their age.
<se_low>Yangus: I wanna get the 'orse-princess back as soon as possible an' all, but...
<se_low>Yangus: I doubt Red's gonna make life easy for us, like.
<se_low>Yangus: It's doin' me 'ead in worryin' about wot daft demands she's gonna come out wiv next!

<se_low>Yangus: I know we've already got the Venus' tear.
But if we go an' 'and it over just like that, she won't 'ave no gratistude.<page>Yangus: We gotta play the game a bit, see!
<se_low>Yangus: We gotta PRETEND we're goin' to the cave like wot she wants.
<se_low>Yangus: I know it must be 'ard for the 'orse-princess, but she's gonna 'ave to 'old on a bit longer.
<se_low>Yangus: First we've gotta get the Venus' tear.
<se_high>Jessica: I knew it! The Princess is here!

<se_high>Jessica: You just hold on, girl!
We'll talk to Red and get you out of this mess!

<se_high>Jessica: Hey! I just had a thought.
What if we just break the Princess out of here and run?
<se_high>Jessica: But I suppose that wouldn't make us any different from the thief who took her in the first place. We'd better trade that jewel for her.
<se_def>Angelo: We were right not to bring King Trode here.
<se_def>Angelo: If he'd seen the Princess like this, who knows what he might have done? He might have tried to break her out and got us into even more trouble.

<se_def>Angelo: But this isn't a bad stable, as it goes.
Far better than anything we had back at the abbey, that's for sure.
<se_def>Angelo: Don't you think the Princess would be far happier living here than being forced to continue on with us on our gruelling journey?
<se_high>Jessica: Um, don't you think we should make the ship our first priority? We need to go to Trodain Castle and find out more about it.
<se_high>Jessica: I guess it's okay to take a detour, but we shouldn't waste too much time.
<se_low>Yangus: It was that Dhoulmagus who covered the castle wiv thorns then, eh? There's prob'ly monsters inside.
<se_low>Yangus: Maybe we should go an' do a bit of confessin' in church first, guv. Make sure this Goddess is on our side an' all that. Better safe than sorry!
<se_def>Angelo: You know, we've still got unfinished business at Trodain Castle.
<se_def>Angelo: I thought old freaky-features said we should look for something in the library. It's disrespectful not to listen to what he says, you know.
<se_high>Jessica: Aren't you worried that Red will just try to scoop the Moonshadow harp up for herself if we mention it? Or am I just being paranoid?
<se_low>Yangus: Please, guv! I don't wanna talk to Red!

<se_low>Yangus: Ooops! Listen to me givin' you lip!
Sorry. It's 'er, y'know. She brings it out in me.
<se_def>Angelo: I just can't believe that Yangus and Red had anything going on before!
<se_def>Angelo: Or is there a smart, handsome Yangus inside our rotund friend, just bursting to get out?
<se_high>Jessica: Aren't we supposed to go through the tunnel in Ascantha Castle and find the thieves who stole the Moonshadow harp?
<se_high>Jessica: We'd better hurry up and give chase before it's too late! Come on!

<se_high>Jessica: They're pretty strong for a bunch of moles!
This is crazy!
<se_high>Jessica: We can't let them beat us. Let's go back and show them what we're really made of!
<se_low>Yangus: There's this place north of Ascantha surrounded by mountains. The only way to get there's by diggin' an 'ole.
<se_low>Yangus: Not a bad place for a thief's 'ideout, I reckon. Maybe that's where the geezer who stole the Moonshadow 'arp is.
<se_low>Yangus: Let's get a move on back to Ascantha Castle!
<se_low>Yangus: We ain't lettin' them moles keep the Moonshadow 'arp!
<se_low>Yangus: Moles... I dunno!
<se_low>Yangus: Just thinkin' about that awful racket the fat one made is enough to bring me dinner back up! Uuurgh!
<se_def>Angelo: I know the King said he'd summon his men and all that...

<se_def>Angelo: But it's King Pavan, right?
Hardly the most dynamic person we've ever met.
We'd better take care of this ourselves.

<se_def>Angelo: These moles won't get the better of us.
Right?
<se_def>Angelo: We'd better make sure we show them who's boss this time, or we'll never live it down!
<se_high>Jessica: We've got the harp! Now all we have to do is take it back to Ishmahri and he can use it to get the ship moving again.
<se_high>Jessica: Come on, let's hurry back to Trodain Castle! We've got to get back into that weird moon world!

<se_low>Yangus: I've been thinkin'.
We ain't never really been on a long boat journey together before, eh, guv?
<se_low>Yangus: Shame we can't rustle up a few deckchairs an' enjoy it a bit more, but I s'pose chasin' Dhoulmagus comes first.

<se_low>Yangus: Come on then, guv.
Let's go an' give the 'arp back to that Itchy-Marie bloke.

<se_def>Angelo: What was it that he said, that Ishmahri character?
Something about awakening the sea's memories?
<se_def>Angelo: It's rather a strange concept to get your head round... Still, no need for us to bother with the details.
<se_def>Angelo: Let's just head back to Trodain Castle and go through the Moonshadow window in the library.

<se_high>Jessica: Red's so angry all the time!
Does she really hate Yangus that much?

<se_low>Yangus: Come on, guv! Please! Anyone but 'er!
I'll go an' see anyone else ya want.
Just not Red! I'm beggin' ya!

<se_def>Angelo: What's wrong with Red?
She prefers something a little more burly, does she?

<se_def>Angelo: Shame. She's a fine-looking woman.
It really is an inexcusable waste.
<se_low>Yangus: Red ain't the kinda lady who's gonna sit around the 'ouse cryin' just cos Rhapthorne's comin' back.

<se_low>Yangus: You ain't gotta worry about 'er. I know I ain't.
Not at all! Not-at-ALL!
<se_low>Yangus: I've gotta bring this flail o' fury back once we're done wiv Rhapthorne.

<se_low>Yangus: I broke a promise to Red once before, an' I ain't makin' the same mistake twice!
It ain't worth it!
<se_high>Jessica: Are we visiting everyone's home one last time before we face Rhapthorne, is that the idea?
<se_high>Jessica: If you're doing this because you don't expect to make it back, stop being such a lily-livered sentimentalist!
<se_high>Jessica: We're going to take care of Rhapthorne, and we're all going to come back in one piece! Got it?
<se_high>Jessica: Are we visiting everyone's home one last time before we face Rhapthorne, is that the idea?
<se_high>Jessica: If you're doing this because you don't expect to make it back, stop being such a lily-livered sentimentalist!
<se_high>Jessica: We're going to take care of Rhapthorne, and we're all going to come back in one piece! Got it?

<se_def>Angelo: We're on the threshold of a truly epic battle.
One or more of us may not be coming back.<page>Angelo: It's about time Yangus and Red came clean about their feelings, don't you think?
<se_def>Angelo: Mind you, that would require a momentary ceasefire in their war of insults, so I suppose I shouldn't hold my breath.

<se_def>Angelo: ‘Make sure you give it back’?
That sounds suspiciously like, ‘Make sure you don't get yourself killed, Yangus’!<page>Angelo: Why doesn't she just say what she means?

<se_def>Angelo: Well, it sounds like our favourite criminal romance remains at the frustrating status of ‘just good friends’.<page>Angelo: Ah well, that'll have to do for now.
We need to get going.
<se_low>Yangus: Just so as ya know, guv, I ain't really int'rested in seein' Red no more.
<se_low>Yangus: So if you ain't got nuffin' spific in mind, would ya just give it a rest!?
<se_high>Jessica: I wonder what Red ended up doing with the Venus' tear?

<se_high>Jessica: I can't imagine her selling it.
She probably tucked it away somewhere safe and sound. Good for her.
<se_def>Angelo: I'd say there's a reason for Red's volatile temper whenever Yangus is around. In my ‘professional’ opinion, there's some chemistry there.

<se_def>Angelo: But don't ask me for advice.
I'm no love doctor.
I'm a practitioner, not a consultant!
<se_def>Angelo: They should be able to figure it out for themselves at their age.

<se_low>Yangus: Looks like Red ain't here, eh? That's a relief.
...Although, now I'm 'ere, I wouldn't really mind seein' the ol' girl...
<se_high>Jessica: I wonder what Red ended up doing with the Venus' tear?

<se_high>Jessica: I can't imagine her selling it.
She probably tucked it away somewhere safe and sound. Good for her.
<se_def>Angelo: We're looking for a dog, right?

<se_def>Angelo: Well I'm pretty sure there aren't any here.
Red's more of a fox, in my opinion.
So did we come here for some other reason?
<se_low>Yangus: We're s'posed to be racin' Red, not droppin' in at 'er 'ouse!
<se_low>Yangus: While we're standin' around gabbin', she's prob'ly gettin' 'er 'ands on Captain Crow's treasure.
<se_low>Yangus: We've gotta get back to the cave. Quick!
<se_high>Jessica: Hey! You aren't thinking of stealing the Venus' tear back while Red's away, are you?

<se_high>Jessica: You're terrible!
We gave it to her, fair and square!
<se_def>Angelo: Shocking news, I'm sure, but Red isn't here.
<se_def>Angelo: Correct me if I'm wrong, but...are you plotting some underhand scheme, <hero>?
<se_low>Yangus: I can't believe Red's sayin' she's comin' along wiv us...
<se_low>Yangus: Sorry about all this, guv. She never listens to nuffin' anyone says once she's made up 'er mind about somefin'. ...Or maybe it's just nuffin' I say.
<se_high>Jessica: He acts all shocked and troubled, but I get the feeling maybe Yangus isn't as unhappy about Red joining us as he makes out.

<se_def>Angelo: From now on, I'm keeping my mouth firmly shut about Red and Yangus.
They can have my blessing.

<se_low>Morrie: The rosa rossa has the two fine men to look after her place while she is away travelling
with us, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Si, she is a woman over my own heart! I have the fine women to look after my place. ...But I have four!

<se_low>Morrie: The rosa rossa has the two fine men to look after her place while she is away travelling
with us, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Si, she is a woman over my own heart! I have the fine women to look after my place. ...But I have four!
<se_low>Morrie: The lady of the house is not at home, ay? We come again another time.
<se_low>Morrie: You like to poke around the young lady's place when she is not looking, ay, ragazzo, you young stallion!
<se_low>Morrie: Ah ha ha! Si, you are young! The PASSION of youth is FANTASTICO!

<se_low>Morrie: When I look in the sea of signor Yangus's eyes
<endash> the way he is looking at the rosa rossa <endash> it takes me back to one of the great romanza of
my young days...

<se_low>Morrie: Such a strong lips... Strong, succulent, POWERFUL lips... I tried to invite her in my pit, but no! It was not to be.<page>Morrie: Some monsters will never join the monster teams. Some romanzi, they are coming to nothing.
<se_high>Red: All right, let's get one thing straight. I ain't playin' 'ostess just cos we're back at my gaff!
<se_high>Red: Aaahhh... Yeah, there's nuffin' like yer own 'ome turf, eh? I s'pose if anyfin' 'appens to me, me dogsbodies will be a bit stuffed, won't they?
<se_high>Red: Anyway, ta, <hero>. I've 'ad words wiv 'em now, so I'm ready to 'it Rhapthorne's place whenever yer up for it.
<se_high>Red: ...Wot? I ain't 'andin' nuffin' else out, no matter wot looks ya give me!
<se_high>Red: You should count yerself lucky. There ain't no one else stupid enough to feel sorry for such an ugly mush!
<se_high>Red: Right, stop starin' at me! Come on, ain't we s'posed to be seein' off Rhapthorne?
